alert.note: Alert for Coastal Bay; Coastal Franklin; Coastal Gulf; South Walton (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued March 06 at 3:56AM EST until March 08 at 5:00AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Walton, Bay, Gulf, and Franklin County Beaches. * WHEN...Through late Monday night. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The rip current risk is expected to remain high through at least Monday night. Despite the nice warm weather and surf of only 2 to 3 feet, strong and frequent rip currents are expected to be dangerous for all levels of swimmers, especially those who are unaware of the dangers rip currents pose.
info.instruction: Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Bay; Coastal Franklin; Coastal Gulf; South Walton
